page.title: 04FISHING NEAR LIVINGSTON
page.content: The{Lower Reservoir}at{Morton}near {Livingston}is now leased as a private fishing club from{Lothian Region, Water and Drainage Department. Only fly fishing is allowed and the reservoir is stocked with{brown and {rainbow trout.}The fishing can be done from the bank, by wading in or by using one of the eight rowing boats. There is a limit of 6lb of fish per fisherman. If this is exceeded the fisherman must pay Â£1 per lb. The largest trout caught in the reservoir was 15lb 6oz. Money made by the fishing club is used to maintain the boats,the club hut and stocking the reservoir. The club was originally private but was opened to the general public in 1981.
